svg.aria-label: Load flow vs per-unit quick cheatsheet
svg.title: Load Flow vs Per-Unit — Cheatsheet
svg.desc: Contrast of load flow quantities (P, Q, V, δ) and per-unit normalization (S_base, V_base, Z_base). Quick bus types and typical uses.

g.text: Outputs: bus voltages/angles, line flows, losses
Choose S_base, V_base → Z_base = V²/S; I_base = S/(√3 V)
Convert: X_pu = X_actual / Z_base; Nameplate %Z → pu
Advantages: scale‑free comparison; easy across Tx levels
Use for: fault level, regulation, quick design checks
Use per‑unit to prepare network impedances; then perform load flow on pu system (common in tools and textbooks).
For this course level: focus on per‑unit for fault/regulation and conceptual view of load flow outputs.
